Jensen's formula

Let fff be a continuous complex-valued function on the closed unit disk D‾\cl{\D}D such that fff is holomorphic on the open disk D={z∈C∣∣z∣<1}\D = \set{z \in \C \mid \abs{z} < 1}D={z∈C∣∣z∣<1} and f(0)≠0f\p{0} \neq 0f(0)=0.

  1. Show that if 0<r<10 < r < 10<r<1 and if inf⁡∣z∣=r∣f(z)∣>0\inf_{\abs{z}=r} \abs{f\p{z}} > 0inf∣z∣=r​∣f(z)∣>0, then

    12π∫02πlog⁡ ∣f(reiθ)∣ dθ≥log⁡ ∣f(0)∣.\frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \log\,\abs{f\p{re^{i\theta}}} \,\diff\theta \geq \log\,\abs{f\p{0}}.2π1​∫02π​log∣∣​f(reiθ)∣∣​dθ≥log∣f(0)∣.

  2. Show that m({θ∈[0,2π]∣f(eiθ)=0})=0m\p{\set{\theta \in \br{0, 2\pi} \mid f\p{e^{i\theta}} = 0}} = 0m({θ∈[0,2π]∣f(eiθ)=0})=0, where m(E)m\p{E}m(E) denotes the Lebesgue measure of E⊆[0,2π]E \subseteq \br{0, 2\pi}E⊆[0,2π].
Solution.

  1. For such an rrr, Jensen's formula applies. Thus, of {an}n\set{a_n}_n{an​}n​ denotes the zeroes of fff on the disk (since f(0)≠0f\p{0} \neq 0f(0)=0, fff is not identically zero, so there are only countably many zeroes), we have

    12π∫02πlog⁡ ∣f(reiθ)∣ dθ=log⁡ ∣f(0)∣−∑∣an∣<rlog⁡∣an∣r≥log⁡ ∣f(0)∣.\frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \log\,\abs{f\p{re^{i\theta}}} \,\diff\theta = \log\,\abs{f\p{0}} - \sum_{\abs{a_n}<r} \log\frac{\abs{a_n}}{r} \geq \log\,\abs{f\p{0}}.2π1​∫02π​log∣∣​f(reiθ)∣∣​dθ=log∣f(0)∣−∣an​∣<r∑​logr∣an​∣​≥log∣f(0)∣.

  2. Since fff has at most countably many zeroes in the disk, there exists a sequence {rn}n⊆(0,1)\set{r_n}_n \subseteq \p{0,1}{rn​}n​⊆(0,1) of radii increasing to 111 such that inf⁡∣z∣=rn∣f(z)∣>0\inf_{\abs{z}=r_n} \abs{f\p{z}} > 0inf∣z∣=rn​​∣f(z)∣>0 for all n≥1n \geq 1n≥1. Since fff is continuous and not identically zero on D‾\cl{\D}D, we have 0<∥f∥L∞<∞0 < \norm{f}_{L^\infty} < \infty0<∥f∥L∞​<∞, which gives

    ∣log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣∣=∣log⁡∣f(rneiθ)∣∥f∥L∞+log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣≤∣log⁡∣f(rneiθ)∣∥f∥L∞∣+∣log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣=log⁡ ∥f∥L∞−log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣+∣log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣≤2∣log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣−log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣.\begin{aligned} \abs{\log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}} &= \abs{\log\frac{\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}}{\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} + \log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} \\ &\leq \abs{\log\frac{\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}}{\norm{f}_{L^\infty}}} + \abs{\log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} \\ &= \log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty} - \log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}} + \abs{\log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} \\ &\leq 2\abs{\log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} - \log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}. \end{aligned}∣∣​log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​∣∣​​=∣∣​log∥f∥L∞​∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​​+log∥f∥L∞​∣∣​≤∣∣​log∥f∥L∞​∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​​∣∣​+∣log∥f∥L∞​∣=log∥f∥L∞​−log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​+∣log∥f∥L∞​∣≤2∣log∥f∥L∞​∣−log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​.​

    Averaging, we obtain

    12π∫02π∣log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣∣ dθ≤2∣log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣−log⁡ ∣f(0)∣.\frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \abs{\log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}} \,\diff\theta \leq 2\abs{\log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} - \log\,\abs{f\p{0}}.2π1​∫02π​∣∣​log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​∣∣​dθ≤2∣log∥f∥L∞​∣−log∣f(0)∣.

    By Fatou's lemma,

    12π∫02π∣log⁡ ∣f(eiθ)∣∣ dθ=12π∫02πlim inf⁡n→∞ ∣log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣∣ dθ≤lim inf⁡n→∞12π∫02π∣log⁡ ∣f(rneiθ)∣∣ dθ≤2∣log⁡ ∥f∥L∞∣−log⁡ ∣f(0)∣<∞,\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \abs{\log\,\abs{f\p{e^{i\theta}}}} \,\diff\theta &= \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \liminf_{n\to\infty}\,\abs{\log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}} \,\diff\theta \\ &\leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \abs{\log\,\abs{f\p{r_ne^{i\theta}}}} \,\diff\theta \\ &\leq 2\abs{\log\,\norm{f}_{L^\infty}} - \log\,\abs{f\p{0}} \\ &< \infty, \end{aligned}2π1​∫02π​∣∣​log∣∣​f(eiθ)∣∣​∣∣​dθ​=2π1​∫02π​n→∞liminf​∣∣​log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​∣∣​dθ≤n→∞liminf​2π1​∫02π​∣∣​log∣∣​f(rn​eiθ)∣∣​∣∣​dθ≤2∣log∥f∥L∞​∣−log∣f(0)∣<∞,​

    since f(0)≠0f\p{0} \neq 0f(0)=0. Thus, log⁡ ∣f(eiθ)∣≠−∞\log\,\abs{f\p{e^{i\theta}}} \neq -\inftylog∣∣​f(eiθ)∣∣​=−∞ for almost every θ\thetaθ, hence f(eiθ)≠0f\p{e^{i\theta}} \neq 0f(eiθ)=0 for almost every θ\thetaθ.
